content.question: Assume that the market for a good is characterized by a downward-sloping demand curve and an upward-sloping supply curve. Suppose that there is an improvement in technology for producing the good. Which of the following would occur?

choices.label: The impact on consumer surplus would be indeterminate, because of the offsetting impact of the changes in equilibrium price and quantity.
The change in equilibrium price would cause producer surplus to increase.
The total economic surplus in the market would increase.
The demand curve would shift right in response to an increase in the equilibrium price.
The supply curve would shift up resulting in an increase in the equilibrium price and the producer surplus.

content.answer: The total economic surplus in the market would increase.

topic.text: 2.7: Market Disequilibrium and Changes in Equilibrium
